sentences: Rasva voi olla terveydelle haitallista liikaa.
Valkoinen leipä on usein rasvaisempaa kuin täysjyväleipä.
context: The Finnish word 'rasva' means fat in English. It refers to the oily, fatty substances found in food and animal tissues. The word can be used as a noun (meaning fat/grease) or as an adjective meaning fatty/fatty when inflected. In nutrition contexts, it refers to macronutrients that provide energy. In cooking contexts, it often describes greasy or rich foods. As an adjective, 'rasva-' is used to describe things containing or having qualities of fat.
